title: Crankshaft - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.

The big end cap will only fit one way, note the orientation of the bearing cap for installation.
Mark each big end cap and connecting rod to identify both items as a matched pair and to identify the correct orientation of the bearing cap to the connecting rod.
It may be necessary to gently tap the big end cap with a rubber mallet to release the cap.
Release the connecting rod bolts and remove the big end cap. Make sure the bearing shell remains in place in the big end cap. Discard the connecting rod bolts.
Detach the connecting rod from the crankshaft. Make sure the bearing shell remains in place with the connecting rod.
Carefully remove the crankshaft from the upper crankcase.
Between cylinders one and two the crankshaft has two thrust bearings fitted to the upper crankcase. Note their position and orientation for installation.
Note the two cut outs on one face of the thrust bearings must face the crankshaft when fitted.
Collect the two thrust bearings from the upper crankcase.
Do not mark any bearing shells with marker paint or anything similar.
To prevent the bearing shells from becoming mixed, place the bearing shells into a individually marked containers. The bearing shells must be refitted in their original positions.
Identify the location of each bearing shell
Remove all bearings and inspect for damage, wear, overheating (blue discolouration) and any other signs of deterioration. Replace the bearings as a set if necessary (see

must fitted to the crankcase to protect the oil spray jets.
If
service tool T3880504
is not used the oil spray jets may get damaged and require replacing.
When fitting
service tool T3880504
, make sure it sits on the oil spray jet and covers the pipe.
To protect the three oil spray jets from damage, use three of the M6 x 30 mm crankcase fixings to fit
